title: now that Ashe have a better version of talon's passive..
body:
Can talon have the old passive of ashe? Or something different from the actuale one?
I really like this new ashe, but like a lot of us I feel that talon has a nearly useless passive, it doesn't even work with all the types of cc!

replies.body:
I agree that Talon needs a new passive badly, but I don't necessarily think that Ashe's old passive is the way to go. That would just turn him into an even burstier character, when he already gives you absolutely no time to react to being jumped on.

Maybe if his passive also applied to bleeds, so he could proc it himself?

he can apply it himself (rake)?

still, it´s pretty uninspired. Sth. bleeding based would be welcome (or sth. like every ability/aa marks the target...at 4 marks they get silenced for 1sec).
I don't think #GiveTalonaSilence is going to be rallying many followers...
He needs something to interrupt channels. He used to be an excellent counter to {{champion:55}} but now he is absolutely helpless once she presses R. It's shameful.
They could give him the {{champion:112}} treatment, where an ability can cancel channels but doesn't silence.

well, it wouldn´t be instant anymore...so there would be counterplay to it. I think it´s rather sad to rob those Champs (Kassa, Talon) off their iconic silence instead of finding a way to involve counterplay in their silence-patterns.

> [{quoted}](name=Don Eulrich,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OzJZY8aL,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2015-04-28T19:51:27.908+0000)
>
> he can apply it himself (rake)?
> 
> still, it´s pretty uninspired. Sth. bleeding based would be welcome (or sth. like every ability/aa marks the target...at 4 marks they get silenced for 1sec).

The slow on rake has a very short duration, since Talon does not stack attack speed he gets at most 2 attacks off with his own rake.

Also, iirc, Talon's combo is usually E - W - R - R - AA - Q, so he doesn't even use his current passive at all when he fights alone.

Correct me if that combo is incorrect.

actually i prefer e-w-aa-q-r-finish or escape. And it´s plenty fast enough to get the bonus on both hits (which is probably the reason he won´t get buffed soon, he´s just too fast to allow meaningfull counterplay in most cases)

That isn't the combo I usually use, but he has different ways to do so it really depends on the situation.

For general team-fight assassinating E+AA+Q+W+Hydra+R (run a bit in a direction) R again is how I normally do it. Gives some quick burst, a way to escape/reposition and lets you land the aoe and apply his passive.


For assassinating someone out of position
Yomuu's + R+ E+AA+Q+W+Hydra

Your combo is good if you have someone engage and lock up their team like a good sejuani or amumu ult for an AOE bomb (since that use of his ult is better for hitting the whole team)

It is funny though how typing out his combo makes it seem like it takes way longer than it actually does XD
Talon have combos?

yes there are various ways to use his skills for optimum output for the situations.
You have better single target burst, safer burst, AoE bombing, Harass/All-in, dueling, etc. and some champs you even combo differently against than others.  It is only minor variations, and usually depends on your build as well. But yes, you have to combo his skills together or you are going OoM without accomplishing much XD
Thanks by the info ;)
No reason to press R again really, the AA will trigger it again anyway or even quicker if you used Q first. but obviously Q counts as an AA reset timer.

> [{quoted}](name=Anyael,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OzJZY8aL,comment-id=000100010001,timestamp=2015-04-28T20:24:00.694+0000)
>
> The slow on rake has a very short duration, since Talon does not stack attack speed he gets at most 2 attacks off with his own rake.
> 
> Also, iirc, Talon's combo is usually E - W - R - R - AA - Q, so he doesn't even use his current passive at all when he fights alone.
> 
> Correct me if that combo is incorrect.

I think the new combo is E - AA - Q - W - R - R

Why not give him a passive that gives him mana either on AA hit or on physical damage to enemy champions? I don't play talon but from what I've heard and seen playing against him, he doesn't need more damage so making his passive do that seems silly. A lot of champions have passives that shore up weaknesses in their kits so why not give talon a passive that rewards risky behavior by giving him mana back so his mana issues aren't as intense.
yeah, i made an example :) but still i think that his passive sucks a lot now
If you feel that Talon gives you no time to react then you need to see the doctor, because literally my grandparents have better reflexes than you...
Can't he proc it himself with W anyway?
All talon needs is his silence back...

No way in hell is he getting it back, he had one of the most cancerous silences in the game.
{{champion:7}}  {{champion:38}}  {{champion:91}}

No not really, he just has stupid solo target easy to use burst, his silence was probably the only justifiable one among those that were removed. Riot didnt fix his problem with that nerf (no counterplay burst)

His solo target burst is kind of his identity, he is an assassin after all. He should be able to jump on someone and at least 75-0 them in an instant because that's what he is. I actually wouldn't have had as much issue with his silence if he was an AP champ because then he would be cooldown reliant, but since he builds AD all he needs is the free advantage from the silence and his AA can do the rest even without abilities. I had games where I built enough health that he couldn't burst me completely, but even when he misjudged his burst I was at a huge disadvantage afterwords because he just traded me 80% of my health and I couldn't respond, so now I'm near death in a close range fight with an AD champ at full health. Basically even if he botched his assassination his silence gave him a free advantage over me, kinda like how if Kass or Lb botched their combos they had the mobility to back out and try again later.

I'll give you that to an extent, but I refuse to yield that he was as bad as LB or Kass, on the basis that, IF he does (pardon the French) fuck up, HE CANNOT GET OUT. 
IMHO, critting and on-hits on his Q shouldnt be a thing

> [{quoted}](name=Lancir,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OzJZY8aL,comment-id=000b0000000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-29T02:37:51.891+0000)
>
> I'll give you that to an extent, but I refuse to yield that he was as bad as LB or Kass, on the basis that, IF he does (pardon the French) fuck up, HE CANNOT GET OUT. 
> IMHO, critting and on-hits on his Q shouldnt be a thing

Stealthy + speed boost != can't get out.

Now kindly look at other assassins {{champion:84}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:55}} who literally have no way to get out.

Sorry bro, but anything that relies on resets as their gimmick isnt an assassin as much a serial killer, kat and akali dont give a flying fuck who they go in on they just go for the easiest one to kill for resets, so not gonna count them, and 5 second invulnerability. 
Side note, do you play Talon? I play him alot, and im telling you now, I barely ever get a chance for a good ulty in a teamfight, I either need both parts for instant burst before the target gets out of range or I use it to engage. It's not as easy as you think, every time you try to use your ult like that everything else in your kit becomes super telegraphed.

> [{quoted}](name=Lancir,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OzJZY8aL,comment-id=000b000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2015-04-29T05:19:52.824+0000)
>
> Sorry bro, but anything that relies on resets as their gimmick isnt an assassin as much a serial killer, kat and akali dont give a flying fuck who they go in on they just go for the easiest one to kill for resets, so not gonna count them, and 5 second invulnerability. 
> Side note, do you play Talon? I play him alot, and im telling you now, I barely ever get a chance for a good ulty in a teamfight, I either need both parts for instant burst before the target gets out of range or I use it to engage. It's not as easy as you think, every time you try to use your ult like that everything else in your kit becomes super telegraphed.

regareas how gimmick it ia, kat cant get out unless she got someone killed, whilst Talon can leave anytime if things when wrong.

same goes for akali except she can't dash to disengage, only to another target.

Fizz doesn't even hAve an escape.

If you rank lb and zed's escape 10, Talon r has at least a 7. And yes, I don't play  talon, but forgoing the stealth for the sake of dmg is personal choice. not the problem with champion design.

> [{quoted}](name=Lancir,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OzJZY8aL,comment-id=000b00000000000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-30T04:08:48.086+0000)
>
> The whole issue is that its not practical. Sivir probably has the highest teamfight damage potential in the game between all her aoe, but in complete honesty, IT IS NOT PRACTICAL FOR SIVIR TO GET CLOSE ENOUGH TO USE ALL HER RICOCHETS. 
> Same thing with Talon, simply due to the fact that because you have no true escape, YOU MUST KILL SOMEONE. 9 times out of 10 that means you aint using your ult to GTFO.
> Also, that stealthy escape? {{item:2043}}

Counter-able free escape is still a free escape. Talon commits way less risk compared to other assassins. You rather blow it for 100 dmg, that's your problem, not the champion's. 

To your logic, Graves/Lucian/Tris is underpowered adc who has no escape, because 9 out of 10 they need their dash to chase and kill someone.

Im going to give you a couple of pieces of advice.
1) Don't compare the playstyle of assassins to that of marksmen
2) Don't rehash the same argument multiple times on a champion you don't know enough about.

I have already explained how it isnt practical for talon to use his ult as an escape. And i also think you dont understand what commitment means in this context.
Kat/Akali: goes in for a kill on lowest hp target, therefore 100-0 full assassination is not necessary
Zed/LeBlanc: Both can escape via blinks in case things go south
Fizz: Invulerability on a 5 second cd+zhonyas, ignores unit collision. Furthermore has the option of committing only ONCE ultimate has landed
Now Talon: HIS ONLY FORM OF ENGAGE IS HIS E. Once he has used this he is in the backline on the adc, he now either has to ult and escape, failing his job, wasting cooldowns, and leaving his team in a 4v5, or fully commit to killing the adc at any and all costs. 
IF YOU CANNOT 100-0 THE ADC AS TALON, YOU EITHER LOSE YOUR TEAM THE FIGHT OR YOU DIE.
^bit of a generalisation, but not by much, 87% accurate.
Of ALL of the assassins, Talon is the one where commiting is the most difficult part, you HAVE to know when to go in and WHEN YOU CAN.

I guess the TL;DR is: if you have to use the ult to escape youre probably trash and need a lot more practice

> [{quoted}](name=Lancir,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OzJZY8aL,comment-id=000b0000000000000000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-01T07:45:20.483+0000)
>
> Im going to give you a couple of pieces of advice.
> 1) Don't compare the playstyle of assassins to that of marksmen
> 2) Don't rehash the same argument multiple times on a champion you don't know enough about.
> 
> I have already explained how it isnt practical for talon to use his ult as an escape. And i also think you dont understand what commitment means in this context.
> Kat/Akali: goes in for a kill on lowest hp target, therefore 100-0 full assassination is not necessary
> Zed/LeBlanc: Both can escape via blinks in case things go south
> Fizz: Invulerability on a 5 second cd+zhonyas, ignores unit collision. Furthermore has the option of committing only ONCE ultimate has landed
> Now Talon: HIS ONLY FORM OF ENGAGE IS HIS E. Once he has used this he is in the backline on the adc, he now either has to ult and escape, failing his job, wasting cooldowns, and leaving his team in a 4v5, or fully commit to killing the adc at any and all costs. 
> IF YOU CANNOT 100-0 THE ADC AS TALON, YOU EITHER LOSE YOUR TEAM THE FIGHT OR YOU DIE.
> ^bit of a generalisation, but not by much, 87% accurate.
> Of ALL of the assassins, Talon is the one where commiting is the most difficult part, you HAVE to know when to go in and WHEN YOU CAN.
> 
> I guess the TL;DR is: if you have to use the ult to escape youre probably trash and need a lot more practice

So Sivir is an assassin? k.

you arent listening to me, either you're thick, or you don't really care, either way stop wasting my time please, i shouldnt have to explain this to you AGAIN.

SIVIR AND TALON share a SIMILARITY in that they both have VERY POWERFUL ABILITIES, but it is usually not PRACTICAL for them to BE CAPABLE OF UTILISING THEM TO THEIR FULL EXTENT.

AT NO POINT DID I EVER NOR EVER WILL SAY SIVIR IS AN ASSASSIN.
Now please leave this thread alone, it is clear you don't know what you are talking about, and I'm getting very sick of repeating myself.

Other Talon main here, just trying to bring some calmness to this arguement, to be fair to both parties here, i will start with talon's ult can be used as an escape, it is not a 100% reliable escape though, due to pink, towers, and other true vision mechanics. what i feel Lancir is trying to say here is that, as talon mains, our job in a fight is to find the adc or apc, beat the living shit out of them till they die and then try to help our team with the rest. problem being, we want to do this as fast as possible to reduce the damage they do to our team or us so we burn everything to get to them or kill them. and i mean everything. we can burn our ult and ghostblade to run right past the enemy team and then jump, or sneak around and jump then burst everything to kill them. if we go in then use our ult to escape without killing the adc we essentially just missed a jinx, ashe, or ez ult because we didn't get done what we were supposed to get done. a talon player will go in and do a bunch of damage then ult out. a good talon player, will go in and deal as much damage as possible because we know we have the highest commitment of most assassins
It's basically just, you are an assassin, assassinate, if you have to use your ult to get away there is no way you are getting the kill, in which case you're better off playing a poke mage.

FOR THE LAST FUCKING TIME A MOVESPEED BONUS AND STEALTH IS NOT A FREE ESCAPE, STOP TALKING ABOUT THINGS YOU DO NOT UNDERSTAND, A FREE ESCAPE IS AN ESCAPE THAT WILL WORK EVERY SINGLE TIME UNLESS PREVENTED BY CROW CONTROL, SUCH AS LEBLANC'S 2ND PART W AND ZED'S SHADOW SWAPPING. TALON HAS TO MOVE, IT IS THEREFORE NOT AN ESCAPE.|

AND FINALLY: THE DEFINITION OF PRACTICAL- adjective: practical
1. of or concerned with the actual doing or use of something rather than with theory and ideas.

AND COMMITMENT - noun
1. the state or quality of being dedicated to a cause, activity, etc.

because i dont think you know what either of those mean

> [{quoted}](name=Lancir,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OzJZY8aL,comment-id=000b000000000000000000010000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-02T10:55:00.506+0000)
>
> you arent listening to me, either you're thick, or you don't really care, either way stop wasting my time please, i shouldnt have to explain this to you AGAIN.
> 
> SIVIR AND TALON share a SIMILARITY in that they both have VERY POWERFUL ABILITIES, but it is usually not PRACTICAL for them to BE CAPABLE OF UTILISING THEM TO THEIR FULL EXTENT.
> 
> AT NO POINT DID I EVER NOR EVER WILL SAY SIVIR IS AN ASSASSIN.
> Now please leave this thread alone, it is clear you don't know what you are talking about, and I'm getting very sick of repeating myself.

Overwhelming amount of common sense in your posts. Save and re-read some time later, you might find it funny.

Talon has an escape, a free one in this matter, you'd rather blow it for dmg, it's your business. 

Sivir ricochet has one and only one function - dmg, there is no 'choice' on how she uses it. 

If you use the point: "I have to blow everything because I need to kill someone", it's true for every DPS in this game, be it assassin, adc or mage. To that logic,85% champs (15% tank+support) in this game has no escape, since they need to blow them all to kill someone .
Not as bad no,  since right now people are still complaining about LB and not Talon. I just think their are a lot better ways to help his kit that aren't that kind of cancerous.
agree with you there, for now an interruption should be fine as a placeholder
riot thinks talon is a "toxic" assassin. they are going to keep his passive useless till his rework.
Idea: Talon's basic attack will silence his target for 0.75 seconds. This ability has no cooldown, but can go off on a target once every 10 seconds and is not effected by CDR

Talon is one of those assassins I really enjoy playing, the passive I believe is fine and that he is also in a very good situation right now. He also has one of the fastest combos and can deal a huge amount of damage using  E - W - R - Q this combo allows for instant burst before the opponent can react due to E with no cast time, W has a small cast time and before the rake comes back you can already pull off the R into a Q. When you use the Q it will trigger the ulty again making his combo quick enough to blow his kit before the slow on rake has cleared. So overall he will have an additional 25% damage boost from passive and E.

Don't get me started on his massive aoe damage nukes though!

Everyone's complaining about how bursty he will become, what if they give him a cooldown on his passive. Say he's guaranteed one crit every 30 seconds + moving around out of combat long enough to build stacks? Would that help?

If Talon gets a new passive, he'll need some tune down over the rest of his abilities.

He's still really strong now, and he will get OP if he gets a viable passive, so I hope they won't mess up with him.

Talon is one of those Rare champions with High Risk and High Reward. He has no escape, so once he commits to a kill he either gets it or not. Additionally, he takes skill to play, and set up. You can't just all in someone at low health early game. You have to poke them with rake, harass with EQ and then once they're low enough, go all in. 

He's got Mana issues too. Since his wave clear takes a nice chunk of it. And without it he doesn't have much of a wave clear.

Above all other assassins, Talon is the only one i find dealing with remotely tolerable. Ever since they removed the silence from him he's had legitimate counter play and unlike so many of the more cancerous champs in the game, he has to commit to get kills.
If you give him ashes passive, he will become a version of zed with zero skill shots and no reliance on his ult what so ever for damage
Yea, all except for the fact that he still has to use hard engage and can't bitch out of it if it turned out badly.
Talon can crit though :P

Not really just different and any way they dont got the same role. 
Ashe is a bassic atk range and talon is a brust kill.
